description: The cluster quality of service - virtual machines dashboard contains reports that shows the time and total time each virtual machine have preformed above/below the CPU or the memory threshold, using a single stats and a table.

panels.content: ###### This dashboard contains reports that shows the time and total time each virtual machine have preformed above/below the CPU/memory threshold.

panels.description: This report displays the time virtual machines have preformed above CPU threshold.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR13 - VMs cpu and memory performance
-- in relation to the thresholds set by the user

-- Time above CPU threshold
SELECT
    COALESCE ( AVG ( cpu_above ), 0 ) AS  cpu_above
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN cpu_usage_percent >= '$cpu_threshold'
                            THEN minutes_in_status
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS  cpu_above
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT DISTINCT
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
                    history_datetime,
                    cpu_usage_percent,
                    minutes_in_status
                FROM
                    (
                        SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                        UNION
                        SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                    ) AS stats_vms
                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                                stats_vms.vm_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    -- Here we get only vms in active status
                    stats_vms.vm_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT cluster_id
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                                WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
                            )
                    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user.
                    -- Can be more than one cluster.
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id = '$cluster_id'
                    -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
                                GROUP BY a.vm_id
                            )
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    -- This will determine if deleted entities will be included in the report,
                    -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
            ) AS sub_query
        GROUP BY vm_id
    ) AS all_sub_queries

panels.title: Time Above CPU Threshold (BR13)

panels.description: This report displays the time virtual machines have performed above memory threshold.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR13 - VMs cpu and memory performance
-- in relation to the thresholds set by the user


-- Time above memory threshold
SELECT
    COALESCE ( AVG ( mem_above ), 0 ) AS  mem_above
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN memory_usage_percent >= '$mem_threshold'
                            THEN minutes_in_status
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS  mem_above
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT DISTINCT
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
                    history_datetime,
                    memory_usage_percent,
                    minutes_in_status
                FROM
                    (
                        SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                        UNION
                        SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                    ) AS stats_vms
                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                                stats_vms.vm_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    -- Here we get only vms in active status
                    stats_vms.vm_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT cluster_id
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                                WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
                            )
                    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user.
                    -- Can be more than one cluster.
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id = '$cluster_id'
                    -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
                                GROUP BY a.vm_id
                            )
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    -- This will determine if deleted entities will be included in the report,
                    -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
            ) AS sub_query
        GROUP BY vm_id
    ) AS all_sub_queries

panels.title: Time Above Memory Threshold (BR13)

panels.description: This report displays the time virtual machines have performed below CPU threshold.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR13 - VMs cpu and memory performance
-- in relation to the thresholds set by the user

-- Time below CPU threshold
SELECT
    COALESCE ( AVG ( cpu_below ), 0 ) AS  cpu_below
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN cpu_usage_percent < '$cpu_threshold'
                            THEN minutes_in_status
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS  cpu_below
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT DISTINCT
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
                    history_datetime,
                    cpu_usage_percent,
                    minutes_in_status
                FROM
                    (
                        SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                        UNION
                        SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                    ) AS stats_vms
                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                                stats_vms.vm_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    -- Here we get only vms in active status
                    stats_vms.vm_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT cluster_id
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                                WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
                            )
                    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user.
                    -- Can be more than one cluster.
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id = '$cluster_id'
                    -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
                                GROUP BY a.vm_id
                            )
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    -- This will determine if deleted entities will be included in the report,
                    -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
            ) AS sub_query
        GROUP BY vm_id
    ) AS all_sub_queries

panels.title: Time Below CPU Threshold (BR13)

panels.description: This report displays the time virtual machines have performed below memory threshold.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR13 - VMs cpu and memory performance
-- in relation to the thresholds set by the user

-- Time below memory threshold
SELECT
    COALESCE ( AVG ( mem_below ), 0 ) AS  mem_below
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN memory_usage_percent < '$mem_threshold'
                            THEN minutes_in_status
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS  mem_below
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT DISTINCT
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
                    history_datetime,
                    memory_usage_percent,
                    minutes_in_status
                FROM
                    (
                        SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                        UNION
                        SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                    ) AS stats_vms
                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id =
                                stats_vms.vm_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    -- Here we get only vms in active status
                    stats_vms.vm_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT cluster_id
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                                WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
                            )
                    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user.
                    -- Can be more than one cluster.
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id = '$cluster_id'
                    -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
                                GROUP BY a.vm_id
                            )
                    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    -- This will determine if deleted entities will be included in the report,
                    -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
            ) AS sub_query
        GROUP BY vm_id
    ) AS all_sub_queries

panels.title: Time Below Memory Threshold (BR13)

panels.description: This report displays the total time each virtual machine have performed above the CPU or the memory threshold.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR13 - Cluster Quality of Service - Virtual Machines
-- This query returns for each vm in the specific datacenter,
-- the  "time_above_cpu_threshold", the "time_above_mem_threshold"
-- and the "overall_vm_time".

SELECT *
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            cluster_id,
            vm_id,
            vm_name,
            is_delete,
            vm_delete_only_date,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN cpu_usage_percent >= '$cpu_threshold'
                            THEN minutes_in_status
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS time_above_cpu_threshold,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN memory_usage_percent >= '$mem_threshold'
                            THEN minutes_in_status
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS time_above_mem_threshold,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS overall_vm_time
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT DISTINCT
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,
                    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_name,
                    (
                        CASE
                            WHEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date IS NULL
                                THEN FALSE
                            ELSE TRUE
                        END
                    ) AS is_delete,
                    CAST ( v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date AS date ) AS vm_delete_only_date,
                    stats_vms.history_datetime,
                    cpu_usage_percent,
                    memory_usage_percent,
                    minutes_in_status
                FROM
                    (
                        SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                        UNION
                        SELECT * FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                    ) AS stats_vms
                    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                        ON 
                            (
                                stats_vms.vm_id =
                                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    -- Here we get only vms in active status
                    stats_vms.vm_status = 1
                    -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT cluster_id
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                                WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
                            )
                    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user.
                    -- Can be more than one cluster.
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id = '$cluster_id'
                    -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
                    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
                                GROUP BY a.vm_id
                            )
                    AND stats_vms.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
                    AND stats_vms.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
                    -- This will determine if deleted entities will be included in the report,
                    -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
                    AND
                        CASE
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                                THEN 1=1
                            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                                THEN delete_date isnull
                        END
            ) AS sub_query
        GROUP BY
            cluster_id,
            vm_id,
            vm_name,
            is_delete,
            vm_delete_only_date
    ) AS all_sub_queries
ORDER BY
    cluster_id,
    (
        CASE
            WHEN time_above_mem_threshold = 0 AND time_above_cpu_threshold = 0
                THEN 1 -- Memory and cpu are below the threshold
            ELSE 0 -- Memory and / or cpu are above threshold
        END
    ) ASC,
    all_sub_queries.is_delete ASC,
    -- This will order the vms based on the time the memory and cpu
    -- where above the threshold out of the overall vm time.
    ( CAST ( all_sub_queries.time_above_cpu_threshold AS float ) / CAST ( all_sub_queries.overall_vm_time AS float ) ) * 100 +
    ( CAST ( all_sub_queries.time_above_mem_threshold AS float ) / CAST ( all_sub_queries.overall_vm_time AS float ) ) *100 DESC

panels.title: Cluster Quality of Service - Virtual Machines (BR13)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_latest_configuration_datacenters
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_latest_configuration_datacenters

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cluster_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_latest_configuration_clusters WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'

title: Cluster Quality of Service - Virtual Machines Dashboard
